'''Wisdom''' is having gained knowledge, experience, and intuitive understanding, along with a capacity to apply these well. It is the judicious application of knowledge.<ref>[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/wisdom ''wisdom''], [http://en.wiktionary.org Wiktionary]</ref> To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings.
 
'''Wisdom''' is having gained knowledge, experience, and intuitive understanding, along with a capacity to apply these well. It is the judicious application of knowledge.<ref>[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/wisdom ''wisdom''], [http://en.wiktionary.org Wiktionary]</ref> To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings.
    −
Some see wisdom as a quality that even a child, otherwise immature, may possess independently of experience or wide knowledge. The status of wisdom or prudence as a [[virtue]] is recognized in [[cultural]], [[philosophical]] and [[religious]] sources. Some define wisdom in a [[utilitarian]] sense, as foreseeing consequences and acting to maximize the long-term common [[goodness|good]].{{Fact|date=March 2007}} As such, wisdom is viewed as consisting of ideals and principles that govern all actions and decisions.
+
Some see wisdom as a quality that even a child, otherwise immature, may possess independently of experience or wide knowledge. The status of wisdom or prudence as a [[virtue]] is recognized in [[cultural]], [[philosopthe big dog ate the littel catences and acting to maximize the long-term common [[goodness|good]].{{Fact|date=March 2007}} As such, wisdom is viewed as consisting of ideals and principles that govern all actions and decisions.
     
A student writing an essay on wisdom once said "Wisdom doesn't have the most perfect definition. Wisdom is gained through life experiences and is then applied to life situations. Most of the time, younger people lack wisdom because they lack the life experiences."
